displaytitle: Pectoral/costume ornament in the form of the glyph Ajaw

titles.title: Pectoral/costume ornament in the form of the glyph Ajaw

texts.textentryhtml:
May 1, 1963, Aaron Furman Gallery, New York, sold to Gillett G. Griffin (1928-2016), Princeton, NJ [1]; 1983, gift to the Princeton University Art Museum.

Notes:
[1] According to an invoice in the curatorial file. This is also corroborated by Griffin’s index (M63).

bibliography.boilertext: Allen Rosenbaum and Francis F. Jones, Selections from The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: The Art Museum, Princeton University, 1986)
bibliography.citation: Allen Rosenbaum and Francis F. Jones, Selections from The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: The Art Museum, Princeton University, 1986), p. 254 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Michael D. Coe, The Maya Scribe and His World (New York: The Grolier Club, 1973).
bibliography.citation: Michael D. Coe, The Maya Scribe and His World (New York: The Grolier Club, 1973)., cat. no. 85, 149 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Michael D. Coe and Justin Kerr, The Art of the Maya Scribe (New York: Harry N. Abrams, 1997).
bibliography.citation: Michael D. Coe and Justin Kerr, The Art of the Maya Scribe (New York: Harry N. Abrams, 1997)., pl. 45, p. 117 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Thomas Dickey, Vance Muse, and Henry Wiencek, The God-Kings of Mexico (Chicago: Stongehenge Press, 1982).
bibliography.citation: Thomas Dickey, Vance Muse, and Henry Wiencek, The God-Kings of Mexico (Chicago: Stongehenge Press, 1982)., p. 54 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Linda Schele and Mary E. Miller, The Blood of Kings: Dynasty and Ritual in Maya Art (New York and Fort Worth, George Braziller, Inc. and Kimbell Art Museum, 1986).
bibliography.citation: Linda Schele and Mary E. Miller, The Blood of Kings: Dynasty and Ritual in Maya Art (New York and Fort Worth, George Braziller, Inc. and Kimbell Art Museum, 1986)., pl. 24, p. 83, p. 100 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1983," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 43, no. 1 (1984): p. 18-42.
bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1983," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 43, no. 1 (1984): p. 18-42., p. 38 (illus.)

exhibitions.citation: Unexpected Journey: Gillett G. Griffin and the Art of the Ancient Americas at Princeton (May 7–June 26, 2005)
The Maya Scribe and His World (April 20–June 5, 1971)
The Blood of Kings: Dynasty and Ritual in Maya Art (May 17 - December 14, 1986)

geography.displaygeography: Place excavated: North America, Mexico, Campeche, Maya area, said to be from Uaymil Island
geography.locale: said to be from Uaymil Island

caption: Maya, Late Classic Period, 600–800, Northern lowlands, Campeche, Maya area, Mexico, Mesoamerica, Pectoral/costume ornament in the form of the glyph Ajaw. Conch shell with red pigment; 7.7 x 7.1 x 0.6 cm. Gift of Gillett G. Griffin (y1983-51)
